metadata.unit_designation: Polish Carpathian Brigade Karpacka Brygada Strzelc W

narrative.title: Polish Carpathian Brigade Karpacka Brygada Strzelc W - 1941Q3
narrative.situation: British independent_infantry_brigade deployed in North Africa during 1941Q3.
narrative.objectives: Fortress defense - Tobruk perimeter southern sector. Aggressive patrolling and defensive operations during Axis siege.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Tobruk Fortress - coastal port with Italian-built fortifications, anti-tank ditches, concrete bunkers, barbed wire obstacles, minefields. Rocky coastal terrain, desert plateau inland, wadis providing covered approaches.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Siege warfare endurance and morale maintenance

environment.terrain_type: Tobruk Fortress - coastal port with Italian-built fortifications, anti-tank ditches, concrete bunkers, barbed wire obstacles, minefields. Rocky coastal terrain, desert plateau inland, wadis providing covered approaches.
